section.section: The Governor shall appoint each member under paragraph (2)(iii), (iv), (v), and (vi) of this subsection with the advice of the Secretary.

text.section:
A designee of the Secretary:
may not be or ever have been employed in the shipping or maritime industry; and
may not have or ever have had a financial interest in the shipping or maritime industry.

While a member of the Board, the consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board; or
grade any examination given by or for the Board.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of an appointed member is 2 years and begins on June 1.
The terms of appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
An appointed member may not serve more than 2 terms consecutively.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
